{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3733201,"name":"M. Oğuz Özgür","username":"oguzozgur","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oguzozgur/{size}/229514_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-07T18:48:57.194Z","cooked":"

trterminal1920×960 1.06 MB

I am looking at our options for motor terminals that we can source domestically.

  • Left terminal: Rated up to 6 mm², M4 mounting hole, commonly available here in Türkiye.
  • Right terminal: The pre-crimped terminal that comes with the Kraken.
  • Both are 1 mm thick, with ~7.25 mm outer diameter.
  • The main difference is inner diameter: left ~4.25 mm, right ~3.75 mm.

I was wondering if the left terminal would lead to any noticeable drop in performance, increased heating, or other issues compared to the pre-crimped ones. Thanks in advance!

Looking up its current capabilities, it shouldn’t significantly affect performance beyond a couple percent

M3.5 is equivalent to #6 (though less common than M4).

I think Farnell should ship to Turkey. At the very least they let you select it as the country and the stock/minimum order quantities changed.

https://tr.farnell.com/panduit/p10-6r-l/terminal-ring-tongue-6-10awg/dp/2727166

Slightly bigger OD, but still should fit. According to the CAD, the Kraken can fit ring terminals up to 0.36”, that part is 0.31”.
